value.title: Wednesday with DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Welcome to my new Power BI DAX Series. Every Wednesday, we will talk about different DAX functions.

topItems.title: DAX Functions Overview - Date and Time Function in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Welcome to my new series – “Wednesday with DAX”. This is the first video of this series. The first episode covers all Date and Time functions used in Power BI In this video, we will talk about Date and Time functions in Power BI. We will discuss about most useful date and time functions in Power BI.

topItems.title: DAX for Power BI - Calculate Cumulative Sum (Running Total) of Count in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: The cumulative total is also known as Running total and during this video, we will talk about how we can calculate a cumulative sum for request count using Power BI Dax measure in Power BI. topItems.title: After Union Two tables, data goes to the wrong column with Power BI DAX?
topItems.excerpt: Most of us have used Union DAX expression in Power BI. Basically union, appends rows from both the table which are common. value.title: Computing rolling average in DAX
value.excerpt: Computing the rolling 12-months average in DAX looks simple, but it hides some level of complexity.  This article explains how to write the best formula and how to avoid common pitfalls using time intelligence functions. Article and download: https://sql.bi/15161?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Introduction to creating measures using DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) is a programming language that is used throughout Microsoft Power BI for creating calculated columns, measures, and custom tables. It is a collection of functions, operators, and constants that can be used in a formula, or expression, to calculate and return one or more values. You can use DAX to solve a number of calculations and data analysis problems, which can help you create new information from data that is already in your model.

value.title: Generate Year and Month Combinations in Power BI Report using DAX
value.excerpt: A common requirement when reporting data with a Date axis is to be able to see the year and the month in a short form beside each other. value.title: Power BI DAX   Previous Month to Date, Quarter to Date, and Year to Date Calculations
value.excerpt: If you want to compare the sales up to a particular day and compare it with the previous period (month, quarter, or year) but up to that particular day in that period, then it is called previous month-to-date, previous quarter-to-date, and previous year-to-date. value.title: Introducing RANKX in DAX
value.excerpt: RANKX is a simple function used to rank a value within a list of values. Its use is simple, but it can be a source of frustration for newbies. Article and download: https://sql.bi/760169?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt
